definition: a day drags past like a year (idiom); time hangs heavy/time crawls when one is wretched
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences
to estimate/Taiwan pr. [duo4]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
as/as if/such as
grain/harvest (old)/variant of 年[nian2]
surname Nian
year/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: You find it difficult to get things done or even at least get through the day.
sentences.chinese: 你会感觉很难把事情做好，甚至度日如年。

sentences.english: It's been so quiet since you've gone, And everyday feels more like a year.
sentences.chinese: 你离开后生活如此平静，而我竟觉度日如年。

sentences.english: A difficult boss can make your time at work miserable.
sentences.chinese: 一个难缠的上司会让你觉得在工作时度日如年。

sentences.english: I'm counting the seconds until the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 我度日如年地盼望着周末的到来。

sentences.english: The black king in ice on a non-working cannot help keep call spittor king.
sentences.chinese: 黑大王在冰牢度日如年，忍不住不停地召唤金蟾大王。

sentences.english: Feel one day like one year at that time. Now my body is very good.
sentences.chinese: 去年我在医院度日如年，如今身体棒的很。

sentences.english: Having unpleasant neighbours can make one's life an absolute misery.
sentences.chinese: 邻居不好也能叫人度日如年。

sentences.english: She frets away all the time when he isn't at home.
sentences.chinese: 他不在家的时候她真是度日如年。

sentences.english: Thank God, finally had struggled to live with it through the difficult period.
sentences.chinese: 谢天谢地，总算熬过了度日如年的困难期。

sentences.english: Because when we are in your class, we feel that one day seems a year.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们听教授的课有种度日如年的感觉。

sentences.english: When we're apart, days feel like years.
sentences.chinese: 当我们分开了，简直是度日如年。

sentences.english: Waiting for the results of the day gets longer time two people burn with impatience.
sentences.chinese: 在等待检验结果的时间里两人心急如火度日如年。

sentences.english: I hardly waited a day before being deluged with responses.
sentences.chinese: 在回复没汹涌而至前，我度日如年。

definition: to suffer/to torture/to torment/ordeal/suffering/torture/torment
hard to bear/unendurable (pain, suffering)
to bathe one's face in tears (idiom)
trying/difficult
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to feel apprehensive/to be alarmed
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
lit. agitated sitting or standing (idiom)/restless/fidgety
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
physically and emotionally exhausted
no thought for tea or rice (idiom); melancholic and suffering/to have no appetite
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
to be both mentally and physically exhausted (idiom)
to feel a pain like a knife being twisted in one's heart (idiom)
